I personally enjoy the game and have gotten all of the DLC's on sale overtime, but over the course of the past year I've played it's gotten buggier with every update and killers have been nerfed into the ground (e.g. deathslinger).

If BHVR fixed the game and didn't mess up literally every update then it'd be a great game to play.

Whilst it's hard to look past the problems with this game, it's still fun to play with friends on survivor, alone as killer (although expect to struggle until you get good perks which often requires buying DLC and grind for ages), or even doing custom matches with friends.

Hunt friends and strangers for fun and profit! Run away from exciting new people! Visit exotic and strange locations!

To be honest, when I first got this game; it was pretty fun, I didn't know any better about it. I got it on PS4 since 2017 and yes I saw drastic changes in visual and some type of mechanic wise. Now I play Dead By Daylight on the PC and I must say it was better for a while. The movement felt smoother and less clunky than the one on the PS4. It was pretty much a simple cat and mouse game with a 4v1. 

Now the issues in this game; the balancing is absolutely horrible. I'm pretty sure there are so many other reviews that already addresses that issue and for the ones that plays that game for a while like me.
The micro-transactions are real annoying since it shows they barely care about the game for example: Fixing the game breaking bugs. Balancing between the 4v1. Frame rate in this game is absolute garbage for PS4 users. The Halloween Event in 2020 was garbage, you couldn't work for it; you had to pay for it. Grinding in this game is very tedious and very boring. The Twins DLC was absolutely unacceptable for releasing an unfinished product and charging money for it. This game is extremely toxic like players would go in their way to leave hate messages on your profile. Oh and I did recall that some people get banned from the Developer's friends just because they don't like how the player plays. Let's say that this game does not deserve to be that popular to begin with.

Now the big question, should you get this game? From my understanding from most and my opinion on this game is no, since it gets repetitive very fast and playing solo is a real chore. Not only that, the developers does not listen to their consumers.

It's weird because you play a game for hundreds and hundreds of hours, and ultimately dislike the game. It's just become not as fun anymore. I play both sides, the matches are becoming too similar, and there's nothing inherently new about the basic gameplay after almost five years of being out. I wish for different objectives, different gamemodes, because it's becoming extremely stale and lackluster. The first few hundred hours were the best, because it felt like an actual challenge and the grind felt rewarding once you unlocked more perks that assisted you. Once you reach the best of your abilities, not specifically rank 1, but where you are able to effectively play the game and perform well almost every round, then the excitement and thrill plateaus and there's nowhere else to go. With the one gamemode, and extremely similar maps with the same types of loops, obstacles, and objectives, it brings no new ways of playing. New killers don't bring the needed refreshment, and are semi-fun for the first week or two after they're released. It's sad when a flashlight save or a dodge of some sort is the most exciting part of a round as survivor. 

The community can be extremely unfriendly as well, as many players will pinpoint one thing you did wrong in a round, and either directly attack you in the post-game chat or on your steam profile. It can be very upsetting if you're a new player. Even after playing hundreds or even thousands of hours, people still have bad games and make mistakes; it's as if the community has no empathy for that, and expects everyone to play their best every round. However, most people you come across are usually friendly enough, but the bad definitely outshines that in this game. 

Pretty sad because I used to enjoy this game so much the first two years I played it. It still has a lot of future potential, but it seems as if the developers have become complacent. Again, I wish for more gamemodes, different objectives, and just something to keep this game interesting. I think about games like Overwatch that created a community fueled gamemode page, and I think something along those lines would work extremely well with this game. Even though these are still in ptb, I'm going to use them as an example. The new animations and hud display are a step in the right direction, as they're trying something new, but the new hud is so funky and unneeded, and would have worked better as an upgrade to the already existing hud, rather than moving everything around, and making things more confusing for every player. Just make the number of times hooked under the already existing player profiles in the hud that no one ever complained about. The animations are unpleasing to look at, but I hope they fix it and are planning on doing something with those new animations in the future. It's nice to see them trying new mechanics and layouts, but it's misguided and feels like a high-schoolers design or animation class project rather than a big company with a huge "fan"base.

But alas, there's no need to change things when tens of thousands of people will continue playing your game no matter what you do to it. I will be one of them, because even though I dislike many things about this game, and complain a lot, it is still fun enough to play a few matches here and there (meaning I'll probably play hundreds of more hours lol), and has now become nostalgic in a weird kind of way. However, as I play, I will always be wishing for something more, which I may never see from this game. 

This is a game built on love and hate. But I can't recommend it unless you're prepared to go through the dbd experience.
